text: Hooversburg was a community, now extinct, in Perry Township, Miami County, in the U.S. state of Indiana. ==History== A post office was established at Hooversburg in 1872, and remained in operation until it was discontinued in 1901. The community served as a trading point in Perry Township's early history, and was likely named after the Hoover family of settlers. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Geography of Miami County, Indiana Category:Former populated places in Indiana Category:Ghost towns in Indiana
title: Hooversburg, Indiana
